bboxes.raw_text:
Phoenix Union Evening School
and the Maricopa County Health
Department announced that re-
gistration for the next Food
handler 8 courses is now open.


Attendance at the 8-hour
course in sanitary methods and
techniques for handling, prepar-
ing and serving food and drink in
commercial establishments is
required by the County Health
Department Sanitary Code. New
courses start every four weeks.


This requirement may be met
by attending a 2-hour session,
once a week, for 4 weeks. Upon
satisfactory completion of the.
course, certificate will be
issued to those attending.


Foodhandlers who have not
completed this course are to
register for the new courses
which begin February 8, A, S, and
6, 1864. Registration can be
made in the classroom of Phoe-
nix Union Evening School, Room
EOS. Building 8, while attending
the first session on the above
dates. The classes will be held
from TO pm. for four weeks.
An afternoon class will be held
from $40 pm. to 500 pm.
beginning on February 8, 1864.
Registration fee for the course
is ST. so.


Additional information may be
obtained by calling the Division
of Environmental Sanitation,
Maricopa County Health Depart
ment, at AL 8-638l.

LOUISVILLE, Ky.-Addressing
more than 1000 persons, NAACP
Executive Secretary Roy Wilkins
warned against a proposal to
delay introduction of a public
accommodations bill in the Ken
lucky State Legislature until
March 8, awaiting action by Con-
gress on the pending Federal
rights bill.


Gov. Edward T. Breathitt has
announced that he will put pub
lie accommodations bill before
the General Assembly by March
8 if Congress has not acted by
that time.


In his address here, Jan. 20,
the NAACP leader noted that the
Governor timetable would allow
only Is days before the close of
the legislative session. In such
an advent. the bill would be
caught in ga rat race and get
stomped to DEATH" Mr.. wilkins
urged immediate introduction Of
the bill and prompt action on it.


Turning to the national scene,
Mr.. wilkins noted that Louis
Vile Congressman. NJ. G. Sny-
der, had failed to include civil
rights among issues in public
opinion poll he is conducting In
his district.


''In his mind" the NAACP
leader said, "civil rights is not
an Issue. l hope you will re-
member Congressman Synder
come November. You just re-
member him even If they run a
chimpanzee against him. We know
where Congressman Snyder
stands, but we don't know what
the chimp might do"

full articles.headline:
FOODHANDLERS
COURSE OPENS

full articles.headline:
WILKINS URGES
KY. RIGHTS BILL
